revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:51:16.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic6e09871c57804374c103642a9b70b2da057b0de
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic6e09871c57804374c103642a9b70b2da057b0de
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-09-18 13:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2018-09-18 13:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-18 13:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks very much for following through on this. Couple of issues with this solution:

* I'm not sure we want to entirely ignore the ArgsAlreadyParsedError in all cases. That's a meaningful error in some cases that may not be related to this problem. There ought to be an error earlier in the log where the system realizes the database is not there and raises some exception related to that. mod_wsgi is interpreting that as a reason to try to init the application again, but is doing so with the same python process, one which already has the oslo config established. To address that we should probably make it so wsgi.py doesn't use global CONF but recreates a new one each time init_application is called. If that's done then the database problem will either just "be fine" or show up as a different error. If that's more than you're wanting to dig into at this point, I can do it.

b) We've frozen placement in nova and are working in https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/placement now. Presumably we'll want to backport this change, however. That will allows us to set the process for how we deal with backports from placement -> nova.

Let me know what you think.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-09-18 14:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-23767 : SUCCESS in 59m 32s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-09-18 15:06:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/603372/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 00m 24s'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-09-18 15:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Thanks very much for following through on this. Couple of issues
 > with this solution:

Thanks for taking a look here, Chris.
 
 > * I'm not sure we want to entirely ignore the ArgsAlreadyParsedError
 > in all cases. That's a meaningful error in some cases that may not
 > be related to this problem. There ought to be an error earlier in
 > the log where the system realizes the database is not there and
 > raises some exception related to that. mod_wsgi is interpreting
 > that as a reason to try to init the application again, but is doing
 > so with the same python process, one which already has the oslo
 > config established. To address that we should probably make it so
 > wsgi.py doesn't use global CONF but recreates a new one each time
 > init_application is called. If that's done then the database
 > problem will either just "be fine" or show up as a different error.
 > If that's more than you're wanting to dig into at this point, I can
 > do it.
 
I agree, yes. Your approach would be cleaner and would not simply cover
other potential exceptions. TBH if you could give it a stab, that
would probably be a lot faster than me trying to get to it.
I'll be more than happy to test my specific use case, though.
 
 > b) We've frozen placement in nova and are working in
 > https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/placement now. Presumably
 > we'll want to backport this change, however. That will allows us to
 > set the process for how we deal with backports from placement ->
 > nova.

Ah righto, I missed that this had already happened. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-09-18 16:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-18 16:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

commit_message:
Ignore ArgsAlreadyParsedError exceptions when registering logging options

Currently if the Database goes down for a certain amount of time
the nova placement wsgi process will end up stuck in a loop with
the following traceback and will never recover even after the DB
is back up and functioning. By ignoring this specific exception, the
wsgi process is able to start and will eventually recover by itself.

Before the fix:
1) Bring down galera and wait a few minutes
2) Observe loop of tracebacks:
[12:58:31.319595] mod_wsgi (pid=20): Exception occurred processing WSGI script '/var/www/cgi-bin/nova/nova-placement-api'.
[12:58:31.319659] Traceback (most recent call last):
[12:58:31.319708]   File "/var/www/cgi-bin/nova/nova-placement-api", line 54, in <module>
[12:58:31.319827]     application = init_application()
[12:58:31.319847]   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/api/openstack/placement/wsgi.py", line 102, in init_application
[12:58:31.319891]     _parse_args([], default_config_files=[conffile])
[12:58:31.319907]   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/api/openstack/placement/wsgi.py", line 62, in _parse_args
[12:58:31.319933]     logging.register_options(conf.CONF)
[12:58:31.319958]   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_log/log.py", line 250, in register_options
[12:58:31.319995]     conf.register_cli_opts(_options.common_cli_opts)
[12:58:31.320007]   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2501, in __inner
[12:58:31.320036]     result = f(self, *args, **kwargs)
[12:58:31.320050]   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2783, in register_cli_opts
[12:58:31.320114]     self.register_cli_opt(opt, group, clear_cache=False)
[12:58:31.320137]   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2505, in __inner
[12:58:31.320169]     return f(self, *args, **kwargs)
[12:58:31.320182]   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2775, in register_cli_opt
[12:58:31.320205]     raise ArgsAlreadyParsedError("cannot register CLI option")
[12:58:31.320262] ArgsAlreadyParsedError: arguments already parsed: cannot register CLI option
3) Bring up galera and still observe tracebacks at 2)

After the fix:
1) Bring down galera and wait a few minutes
2) Observe a couple of mysql lost connection messages:
[12:44:34.293986] DBConnectionError: (pymysql.err.OperationalError) (2013, 'Lost connection to MySQL server during query') (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/e3q8)
3) Bring up galera and observe no such traceback loops

Change-Id: I0955be1243413e19a9078e31a4c55c9d6abe4494
Closes-Bug: #1784155

commit_message:
Disable neutron-vpnaas-agent

The Neutron VPNaaS agent has been dropped in the Queens release
and replaced by a plugin in L3 agent[1].

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron-vpnaas/queens.html

Change-Id: Idb171b3a242483fc2bb9cf837c815a6fb6d3a0de
(cherry picked from commit 44150511780d6619e4b11a702d787224fb11ea1d)

commit_message:
Add openstack/placement as a required project for ironic-grenade*

In order to get openstack/placement installed as part of the
ironic grenade jobs, we have to list it as a required project.

Needed by https://review.openstack.org/604454/

Change-Id: I3922ef15ef8b4517f653a37ca137ba30c8ca5643

"While not strictly necessary, it is a good idea to decide ahead of time which disc node will be the upgrader, stop that node last, and start it first. Otherwise changes to the cluster configuration that were made between the upgrader node stopping and the last node stopping will be lost."

We had a passing publish job this morning: http://zuul.openstack.org/builds.html?job_name=kolla-publish-ubuntu-source'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-09-24 11:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Looking at the job timings, the Depends-On here clearly isn't triggering an image build."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-09-24 13:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

If the depends on change is merged, is not triggered'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-24 13:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

> If the depends on change is merged, is not triggered

Of course. That makes sense. We do end up in a bit of a difficult situation in kolla since our images might not have been published yet.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-10-01 12:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Seems to be causing a kayobe CI job to fail: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568804/20

ERROR: epmd error for host centos-7-rax-ord-0002468714: address (cannot connect to host/port)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-10-01 12:20:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> Seems to be causing a kayobe CI job to fail: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568804/20
 > 
 > ERROR: epmd error for host centos-7-rax-ord-0002468714: address
 > (cannot connect to host/port)

It's possible in that case that the hostname does not resolve to the IP of the host's api_interface, perhaps that is causing the issue."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-10-01 14:00:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> > Seems to be causing a kayobe CI job to fail: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568804/20
 > >
 > > ERROR: epmd error for host centos-7-rax-ord-0002468714: address
 > > (cannot connect to host/port)
 > 
 > It's possible in that case that the hostname does not resolve to
 > the IP of the host's api_interface, perhaps that is causing the
 > issue.

Looks like it was in fact caused by the hostname not resolving to the API IP address. We have a workaround in place to get us moving again."}]

commit_message:
Raise exception for unsupported microversion

In order to raise visibility and also ensure that we keep the
last known API microversion up to date in the http client,
we must raise an exception early in the client initalization
if we know that the version requested is greater than what can
be supported.

Adds a check into the v1 client intializaiton that will raise
a version exception should the requested API microverison
be beyond the LATEST_KNOWN microversion.

Change-Id: I45d7c40ab97c5a631395f1bd335a95b2ce9525cf
Related-Bug: #1739440
Related-Bug: #1671145

commit_message:
ironic: stop hammering ironic API in power sync loop

Use our node cache to look up the node for an instance, if we have it.
If we can't find it, fall back to hitting ironic's API.

This should be relatively up-to-date info, as it is refreshed on every
resource tracker loop.

Closes-Bug: #1793556
Change-Id: I0069cbc327d952d42dbb8fe54949faab89995a7e

commit_message:
Remove deprecated rpc_backend transport option

This option is now part of 'transport_url' option. RPC backend
must now be specified as a full transport URL.

Change-Id: I972fdb1fa73453c809e35c155c649d6b72b34d13
Closes-Bug: #1712399

commit_message:
Rally: Update chart

This cleans up the rally chart, removing some templates and values
entries that are not required for the chart to function

Change-Id: I0e3b30e5ae95116248cfc0c4070722edafe1ae1e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-21 13:16:32.000000000', 'message': "Add nova file_backed_memory and memory_backing_dir support for qemu.conf

The libvirt driver now allows utilizing file backed memory for qemu/KVM
virtual machines, via a new configuration attribute
``[libvirt]/file_backed_memory``, defaulting to 0 (disabled).

``[libvirt]/file_backed_memory`` specifies the available capacity in MiB
for file backed memory, at the directory configured for
``memory_backing_dir`` in libvirt's ``qemu.conf``. When enabled, the
libvirt driver will report the configured value for the total memory
capacity of the node, and will report used memory as the sum of all
configured guest memory.

Running Nova with file_backed_memory requires libvirt version 4.0.0 and
qemu version 2.6.0

Related-Bug: 1793687

Change-Id: I0d9eb21fcab01266e501b7fc63c5b2bbb244956a
"}, {'created': '2018-09-24 10:03:41.000000000', 'message': "Add nova file_backed_memory and memory_backing_dir support for qemu.conf

commit_message:
Add nova file_backed_memory and memory_backing_dir support for qemu.conf

The libvirt driver now allows utilizing file backed memory for qemu/KVM
virtual machines, via a new configuration attribute
``[libvirt]/file_backed_memory``, defaulting to 0 (disabled).

``[libvirt]/file_backed_memory`` specifies the available capacity in MiB
for file backed memory, at the directory configured for
``memory_backing_dir`` in libvirt's ``qemu.conf``. When enabled, the
libvirt driver will report the configured value for the total memory
capacity of the node, and will report used memory as the sum of all
configured guest memory.

Running Nova with file_backed_memory requires libvirt version 4.0.0 and
qemu version 2.6.0

Related-Bug: 1793687

Change-Id: I0d9eb21fcab01266e501b7fc63c5b2bbb244956a

While these options have been deprecated in ocata, they're still in wide use:

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=rabbit_port&i=nope&files=&repos=

I think we need to be realistic here and give the consuming projects more time.

That said, it's apparent that merely marking the configuration option as deprecated isn't enough to encourage devs to make the switch to transport_url.

Is there any way we can make the deprecation more visible?  For example is it acceptable to explicitly issue a run time warning during driver initialization if these options are used?

We could introduce the log now early in the queens dev cycle and start cleaning up the references throughout queens with the goal of removing them early in rocky.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2017-09-08 14:58:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

By "them" in the last sentence I mean the options, not the references.  The references have to be fixed first.'}, {'account_id': 14758, 'date': '2017-09-08 16:23:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> For example is it acceptable to explicitly issue a run time warning during driver initialization if these options are used?

Sounds good. AFAIK, oslo.config doesn't provide a way to specify warning type (warnings.RuntimeWarning) for deprecated options.

We could also send an email to openstack-dev (or to all PTLs if there's a dedicated mailing list) announcing the removal. This can get us a bit further if they decide to cleanup."}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-10-01 13:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Options removal has landed:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/599912/'}]

commit_message:
Remove deprecated options in rabbitmq driver

Removed options:
* rabbit_host
* rabbit_port
* rabbit_hosts
* rabbit_userid
* rabbit_password
* rabbit_virtual_host
* rabbit_max_retries

These options have been replaced by transport_url option.

Change-Id: I3d4c6ea9db4cc6d25245705b85508092c3f6e9fa
Closes-Bug: #1712394

subject: Remove deprecated allow_insecure_clients amqp1 option

Ugh - sorry Rajath I totally forget to tell you this.

Whenever something is deprecated we have to add a release note as part of the change.  We'll need one for this.

It's pretty simple: install the 'reno' tool (available at Pypi https://pypi.python.org/pypi/reno) and run:

$ reno add allow-insecure-clients-option-deprecated

from the top of the oslo.messaging directory.  It will create a file in releasenotes/notes something like 'allow-insecure-clients-option-deprecated-XXXX.yaml

In that file you have to delete all sections but the deprecations section.  In that section you have to just explain that it was never used by the driver.

See the blocking-executor-deprecated-XXX.yaml file for a good example to use.

Again - sorry I forgot about that."}, {'account_id': 14758, 'date': '2017-09-05 18:04:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-05 20:18:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
Clean up the tempest.conf section of the values.yaml

While running chart internal to AT&T we found some
tempest.conf values that are not mapped to the correct section of the
tempest config.py.  This commmit is to address these changes:

1) tempest.auth.admin_domain_scope should be in
tempest.identity.admin_domain_scope
default is false and existing code is
setting the value to true so it is needed
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/config.py#L109

2) tempest.auth.min_compute_nodes should be in
tempest.compute.min_compute_nodes but it is setting the default value so
this is not needed and I am dropping it
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/14.0.0/tempest/config.py#L231

Also while learning about the chart we found that the admin_domain_scope
configmap-etc was mappinng the wrong data type so we removed the map
and set the admin_domain_scope  to true.

Change-Id: I52f115c3a1afee0fd58ef9422c6353ea1a93e814

commit_message:
Support disabling inactive links for Juniper

Adds the necessary code to the Juniper Junos device driver to support
disabling inactive links. This feature is enabled by setting the
per-device config flag 'ngs_disable_inactive_ports'.

Change-Id: I636613d0c910d10601422ad094f835c17a606e37
Story: 2003391
Task: 24933

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-31 15:01:01.000000000', 'message': "Support disabling inactive links

Currently, when a port is unbound by NGS, this is typically implemented
by removing the VLAN association from the corresponding switch
interface. This puts the interface on the default VLAN of the switch,
and leaves it administratively up (active). This may be an issue in some
scenarios, such as:

* If there is more than one interface on the server, subsequent
  instances may choose not to attach a network to one or more
  interfaces. If these interfaces are active on a default VLAN this
  would be a security hole.

* If configuration of an interface fails but is silently ignored by NGS,
  the interface will remain on the default VLAN.

To avoid these issues this change adds support for administratively
disabling ports when they are not in use. This behaviour is optional,
since it might not be appropriate on all devices or in all scenarios.
Configuration of the behaviour is controlled by a per-device config
flag, 'ngs_disable_inactive_ports'.

Change-Id: Ibdbb871d7f3e9ad0d3ade1049cc09a2da5e36fab
Story: 2003391
Task: 24511
"}]
commit_message:
Support disabling inactive links

Currently, when a port is unbound by NGS, this is typically implemented
by removing the VLAN association from the corresponding switch
interface. This puts the interface on the default VLAN of the switch,
and leaves it administratively up (active). This may be an issue in some
scenarios, such as:

* If there is more than one interface on the server, subsequent
  instances may choose not to attach a network to one or more
  interfaces. If these interfaces are active on a default VLAN this
  would be a security hole.

* If configuration of an interface fails but is silently ignored by NGS,
  the interface will remain on the default VLAN.

To avoid these issues this change adds support for administratively
disabling ports when they are not in use. This behaviour is optional,
since it might not be appropriate on all devices or in all scenarios.
Configuration of the behaviour is controlled by a per-device config
flag, 'ngs_disable_inactive_ports'.

Change-Id: Ibdbb871d7f3e9ad0d3ade1049cc09a2da5e36fab
Story: 2003391
Task: 24511

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5b07c573ea3594c011adc0ffbe629f0229e611f0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
move tripleo-ci release files inside CentOS-7 folder

Prepares for adding support for multiple supported releases.
This should be merged with its sister change that creates
softlinks for backwards compatibility.

Used two stage change in order to ease rebasing as these files
are updated often.

Change-Id: I0e36d230942e62d4fe4a17225f9205d67b6e7b2b
Partial-Bug: #1740928

commit_message:
Minor fixes to README.rst

* Correct the title of README.rst (currently it's titled "Team
  and repository tags", which is obviously not the project name).
* Move useful links to the top, so that they're easier to find
  (especially the link to the full documentation).
* Link to api-ref instead of rarely updated wiki page when
  referring to the bare metal API.

Change-Id: Ibd62c7bfc5ff77a16690cfa98f7164906a49abad

commit_message:
Remove tox checkconfig

As we are not maintaining sample config file in the repo now,
the checkconfig can be removed since it's always generated from
the code.

Change-Id: I5bfd7c5cbb048a71864fac4fcfebb940529f87f1

commit_message:
pxe/ipxe: Move common calls out pxe.py

Moves common method calls out of the body of pxe.py into
pxe_utils, and accordingly removes some of the imports
and re-maps the methods for compatability, as unit tests
and methods have not yet been updated.

Tests and methods will be updated in the next patch.

Story: 1628069
Task: 26724
Change-Id: I717c49b99837b1785fc0080106414c6094dbf8eb

commit_message:
Add config_download_timeout input

The config_download_deploy workflow now has a config_download_timeout input
that will honor a user requested timeout. Previously, no timeout was honored
even though the user could request one via tripleoclient.

Change-Id: I522b71f92149e0cee7842d1bcbf35d9e820454b8
Partial-Bug: #1783893

Great start!

You need to remove the "Author:" line from your commit message, git tracks authors anyway.

Also please look into updating the tests in sushy/tests/unit/test_main.py with your new field. Please amend the same patch, keeping the change-id, then resubmit.

I'm putting -1 as a sign that this change needs more work. commit_message:
Add product property to the root Sushy object

Chages made to sushy/main.py
product property is the product associated with this Redfish service.

Change-Id: I2ab5bd73ac609a8563807bdc0d1c1825cd5b4bba

commit_message:
Bump SHA to fix flipping screens in spicehtml5

By bumping this version, we're including;

"Handling non-topdown lz_rgb"
https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/spice-html5/commit/bfa85a7117fcf28ff19f2507f61db4620da2e828

"Handle non topdown bitmaps"
https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/spice-html5/commit/7ba763feb5322f0c97758070075b60cee5464f47

This addresses the "FIXME: Implement non top down support for lz_rgb"
in horizon when viewing Windows VM's with the QXL driver installed.
Before these fixes, gui elements would be rendered upside down.

I'm backdating the "HEAD of master" to the commit date for these fixes,
because the SHA hasn't changed since a commit in 2016-03-08, but
there's been several commits to the project since.

Change-Id: Ic58f200ea60096398dfd7438993a9a8aec5054d7

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5f5af4e4f3526a492717fdcb2568f18847eaf594
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-30 15:01:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add variable for the ssh service

The ssh service on ubuntu based systems is "ssh" which is established by
the service unit path `/lib/systemd/system/ssh.service`. When running
the service will respond to the name "sshd" however this is just an
alias. This change adds a variable to set the service unit name
based on the distro family which will allow the service to start should
it be masked.

Change-Id: I04b9f5ed761270c0bb76b607a6562b511c6f4773
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add variable for the ssh service

The ssh service on ubuntu based systems is "ssh" which is established by
the service unit path `/lib/systemd/system/ssh.service`. When running
the service will respond to the name "sshd" however this is just an
alias. This change adds a variable to set the service unit name
based on the distro family which will allow the service to start should
it be masked.

Change-Id: I04b9f5ed761270c0bb76b607a6562b511c6f4773
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Undercloud upgrade docs -- "yum update" necessary packages

Expand the list of packages to `yum update` prior running `undercloud
upgrade`:

* openstack-tripleo-common -- we use direct Python imports from common
  to tripleoclient.

* openstack-tripleo-heat-templates -- nowadays we upgrade the
  undercloud based on t-h-t content, we need the latest content before
  we trigger the upgrade.

Change-Id: Ie7a51bebb1d18c6f4442c5177f593008819ae51c
Partial-Bug: #1794770

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9c6a9d1137e54863125a72448b86544de87a0372
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

I can't see anything else to stop this going in"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-10-02 22:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

(5 comments)

we made a decision several releases ago to not have os-vif proxy ip and iptables command on behalf of plugins. doing so would require us to extend our public stable interface beyond or current scope.

as such you cannot define the ip_lib.py under os_vif/common and
share them between the ovs and linux bridge plugins.
can you move the code under the ovs plugin and copy the linux implementation to the linux bridge plugin.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-10-03 08:43:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)

In the next patch I'll submit the IP library implemented in both projects, ovs and lb. Of course, for LB only linux implementation."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-10-03 09:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-10-04 12:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

One question: who's going to use this? I'm not aware of anyone using OVS on Windows"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-01-08 18:03:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

os-vif is used for the hyperv driver when ovs is enabled on windows.

This is a lower priority for me but it would still be nice to include this in the queens release.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-01-09 11:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-01-09 12:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-11 19:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

I thought the hyperv driver in nova was using os-vif? How are they not blowing up without this already?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-01-11 20:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

The short answer is that the only place where linux_net.device_exists
is used on windows is here
https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/master/vif_plug_ovs/ovs.py#L177
before 
linux_net.ensure_ovs_bridge and self._create_vif_port
both of these function can be safely called even if the devices exists without failing.

long answer

on windows linux_net.device_exists always retrun false because "'/sys/class/net/%s' % device" or C:/sys/class/net/... will not exist normally.
when i first opened this bug we were actully using process exec to check if the sysfs path existed and catch in the file not found exception
then retruning false.


ensure_ovs_bridge eventually calls 
https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/master/vif_plug_ovs/linux_net.py#L78-L80 which because of the --may-exist will not fail.

_create_vif_port eventrully calls
https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/master/vif_plug_ovs/linux_net.py#L64-L70 which deletes and recreates the port if it already exits.
this could cause a network interuption hower it si completed in a singel translation so it should not.

so basically hyperv is lucky that before hyperv started using os-vif we made added support for vlan aware vms which is why those two functions are now safe to call even though they should normally would need to be protected by device exists and bridge exists checks.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-01-21 19:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-01-22 12:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-09-20 06:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-09-25 00:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

at a cursory glance this all looks fine to me but
i will re review properly in the morning.
thanks for picking these back up.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-09-25 07:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-09-26 13:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-09-26 13:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1794524 to bug/1672812'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-09-26 14:24:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

(6 comments)

There are a couple of nits here and I'd much rather we squash the 'impl_netifaces' and 'impl_pyroute2' modules into their 'windows' and 'linux' parent modules, respectively, but I'm not going to block on this.

Thanks again for picking this back up, Rodolfo :)"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-09-26 14:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-01 10:28:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(4 comments)

ci and stephen seem happy and this looks good to me so +2'}]

Added a network library dependant on the operating system. Windows

Added a network library dependant on the operating system. Windows
and Linux OS are supported. The library is choosen automatically
depending on Python ``os.name``.

Linux library is based on ``ip`` commands and still relying on
``processutils`` library. Linux implementation can't use ``netifaces``
because this library doesn't provide the needed functionality. [1] will
migrate all ``ip`` commands to ``pyroute2`` library.

Windows library relies on Python's ``netifaces`` library because is
enough for the reduced set of commands used. The only functionality
implemented, to cover the bug resolution, is the device existence
check. New functionalities could be added following, for example,
the Neutron implementation.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/484386/

Closes-Bug: #1672812

commit_message:
Add support for Windows network commands

Added a network library dependant on the operating system. Windows
and Linux OS are supported. The library is choosen automatically
depending on Python ``os.name``.

Linux library is based on ``ip`` commands and still relying on
``processutils`` library. Linux implementation can't use ``netifaces``
because this library doesn't provide the needed functionality. [1] will
migrate all ``ip`` commands to ``pyroute2`` library.

Windows library relies on Python's ``netifaces`` library because is
enough for the reduced set of commands used. The only functionality
implemented, to cover the bug resolution, is the device existence
check. New functionalities could be added following, for example,
the Neutron implementation.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/484386/

Closes-Bug: #1672812

Change-Id: I84e3582135ed02137366c8f55f1dd1e4c115f0b5

subject: Avoid race condition using parallel fuel-devops env manipulations
messages: [{'account_id': 15984, 'date': '2018-10-01 09:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15984, 'date': '2018-10-01 09:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15984, 'date': '2018-10-01 09:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15984, 'date': '2018-10-01 09:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15984, 'date': '2018-10-01 10:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15984, 'date': '2018-10-01 10:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11969, 'date': '2018-10-01 11:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-01 09:12:41.000000000', 'message': "Avoid race condition using parallel fuel-devops env manipulations

If multiple processes are creating/erasing different fuel-devops

commit_message:
Avoid race condition using parallel fuel-devops env manipulations

If multiple processes are creating/erasing different fuel-devops
environments at the same time, there can be race condition during
libvirt object creation/deletion like:
'bridge virbr3 already exists' and others.

This patch allows to use a lock file to avoid such situation:
export DEVOPS_LOCK_FILE=/run/lock/devops_lock

If the environment variable DEVOPS_LOCK_FILE is not set, then
the lock file is not used (backward compatibility to avoid any
errors caused by using the lock file by default).

Change-Id: Id28f442959594aa5d6bb5c1d15e4f0880653070d
(cherry picked from commit cce44f4784b4e95a65db9edd0ba72988ad6ee2b7)

Generate a coverage report at the root of the project

Zuul coverage job expects the report in a fixed place:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/zuul-jobs/\
tree/roles/fetch-coverage-output/defaults/main.yaml

commit_message:
Use keystone+cachemanagement as paste flavor for glance

glance has issues with "keystone" flavor when running under
python 3[1], so using keystone+cachemanagement, it's used in
devstack since long.

Also ignore sealert for scenario-py3

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystonemiddleware/+bug/1789351

Change-Id: I2b3b714dfaa96130ef4b7e06bfa5d4260fd08099

commit_message:
Use INFO for logging no allocation candidates

If the placement service returns no allocation candidates, the
log message is done in DEBUG leaving no information for the
operator to have visiblity on why the NoValidHost was raised.

If we do get something from the placement service that results
in 0 compute nodes after going through filters, we do log a
message in INFO.  This is to add consistency for a message
in INFO if we have no allocation candidates.

Closes-Bug: #1794811
Change-Id: Ief2277b3a973dd2f947f354f844ce1c6c4d6026a
(cherry picked from commit a5203536520578f016c6e0f849264039ff146f14)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 10:07:12.000000000', 'message': 'Do not disable ipv6 on loopback interface for epmd

Currently, as discussed in [1], the Erlang Port Mapper Daemon requires that
the loopback interface supports IPv6 in order to initialize properly.
Without that, rabbitmq-server cannot start and deployment fails at step 2.

Until the startup behaviour of epmd is amended, do not disable inet6 support
on loopback device to workaround the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1780065

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rabbitmq-server/+bug/1312507/comments/15

NB: Not a 100% clean cherry-pick

Change-Id: I200acaeaca15e47dc2e3b2462a6254e85477ffb0
(cherry picked from commit 93fb7f08b8e1915ef594192984574f4f9613ccb1)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not disable ipv6 on loopback interface for epmd

Currently, as discussed in [1], the Erlang Port Mapper Daemon requires that
the loopback interface supports IPv6 in order to initialize properly.
Without that, rabbitmq-server cannot start and deployment fails at step 2.

Until the startup behaviour of epmd is amended, do not disable inet6 support
on loopback device to workaround the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1780065

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rabbitmq-server/+bug/1312507/comments/15

NB: Not a 100% clean cherry-pick

Change-Id: I200acaeaca15e47dc2e3b2462a6254e85477ffb0
(cherry picked from commit 93fb7f08b8e1915ef594192984574f4f9613ccb1)

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-09-30 15:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-10-01 06:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-10-01 07:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-30 15:18:12.000000000', 'message': "Make sure rhel-plugin-push.service is stopped after pacemaker stops

When issuing a normal reboot command on an overcloud node the following
stop sequence can take place:
------------- -----------------------------
| Pacemaker | | paunch-container-shutdown |
------------- -----------------------------
          |     |
           \   /
            \ /
        ----------
        | docker |
        ----------

If there are docker plugins that are allowed to stop before docker and
also before pacemaker, it might happen that stopping them down during
the pacemaker stop will cause a bunch of timeouts and a failure to stop
containers:
Sep 13 17:53:00.821030 controller-0.localdomain pacemakerd[6147]: notice: Shutting down Pacemaker
Sep 13 17:54:15.798026 controller-0.localdomain lrmd[6284]: warning: galera-bundle-docker-0_monitor_60000 process (PID 226329) timed out
Sep 13 17:54:15.799004 controller-0.localdomain lrmd[6284]: warning: galera-bundle-docker-0_monitor_60000:226329 - timed out after 20000ms

One of these plugins is 'rhel-push-plugin.service'. It seems that when
this plugin is free to stop before docker on shutdown, it is very
possible that docker commands can start timing out.

Before:
Before adding the symlink we would need 15mins to reboot a node and
we would get a bunch of timeouts on shutdown and some failed actions on
boot.

After:
A reboot will take a reasonable couple of minutes to complete with no
failed actions at boot and timeouts during shutdown.

NB: We add the symlink unconditionally as systemd will ignore it if the
service is not installed.

Closes-Bug: #1792701

Change-Id: I6f6d27f2457efcc49d9edd8a2f98484c5f7c0933
(cherry picked from commit e288dbd8252765020816639b9b53f8212292cfaf)
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure rhel-plugin-push.service is stopped after pacemaker stops

When issuing a normal reboot command on an overcloud node the following
stop sequence can take place:
------------- -----------------------------
| Pacemaker | | paunch-container-shutdown |
------------- -----------------------------
          |     |
           \   /
            \ /
        ----------
        | docker |
        ----------

If there are docker plugins that are allowed to stop before docker and
also before pacemaker, it might happen that stopping them down during
the pacemaker stop will cause a bunch of timeouts and a failure to stop
containers:
Sep 13 17:53:00.821030 controller-0.localdomain pacemakerd[6147]: notice: Shutting down Pacemaker
Sep 13 17:54:15.798026 controller-0.localdomain lrmd[6284]: warning: galera-bundle-docker-0_monitor_60000 process (PID 226329) timed out
Sep 13 17:54:15.799004 controller-0.localdomain lrmd[6284]: warning: galera-bundle-docker-0_monitor_60000:226329 - timed out after 20000ms

One of these plugins is 'rhel-push-plugin.service'. It seems that when
this plugin is free to stop before docker on shutdown, it is very
possible that docker commands can start timing out.

Before:
Before adding the symlink we would need 15mins to reboot a node and
we would get a bunch of timeouts on shutdown and some failed actions on
boot.

After:
A reboot will take a reasonable couple of minutes to complete with no
failed actions at boot and timeouts during shutdown.

NB: We add the symlink unconditionally as systemd will ignore it if the
service is not installed.

Closes-Bug: #1792701

Change-Id: I6f6d27f2457efcc49d9edd8a2f98484c5f7c0933
(cherry picked from commit e288dbd8252765020816639b9b53f8212292cfaf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-27 22:06:05.000000000', 'message': "Set prepare neutron_driver from NeutronMechanismDrivers

Since the fix for bug #1727347 landed, this interacts poorly with the
logic which decides whether Opendaylight or OVN are deployed. Since
tripleo-heat-templates driven image prepare doesn't have access to the
actual resource registry, it doesn't know if a service in the roles
data is mapped to a real implementation in the resource registry.

value of the NeutronMechanismDrivers parameter.

commit_message:
Set prepare neutron_driver from NeutronMechanismDrivers

Since the fix for bug #1727347 landed, this interacts poorly with the
logic which decides whether Opendaylight or OVN are deployed. Since
tripleo-heat-templates driven image prepare doesn't have access to the
actual resource registry, it doesn't know if a service in the roles
data is mapped to a real implementation in the resource registry.

This change switches to determining the neutron driver by using the
value of the NeutronMechanismDrivers parameter.

Change-Id: Ia51a825d11bd9b94d0110f13cdf2a6bbcedf6194
Depends-On: I1fd78fd1eeb071788fc23ba343915ce7d6d14f02
Closes-Bug: #1794103
(cherry picked from commit ddda1549f29c806ff952dd3e7f21a08e64394778)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ica8253d82288ecf2e281b521b7ade989c8d6c442

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Adjust tenacity mock
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-09-30 20:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-09-30 20:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-30 20:34:21.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust tenacity mock

Recent changes in tenacity have broken how we mock the wait call for
the test.  This change mocks out the inspect.getargspec call that is
used in tenacity to fix our unit tests for now. I think it might be
beneficial to not actually test the retry functionality in the paunch
unit tests as it seems to be more of a test for tenacity than paunch.

Change-Id: I37b09694de3ec9f31a7b945d19a83527c915b759
Related-Bug: #1788802
(cherry picked from commit e2093fb7fc0a0d35d5b3ac6a8b5d4a8c373d79c7)
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust tenacity mock

Recent changes in tenacity have broken how we mock the wait call for
the test.  This change mocks out the inspect.getargspec call that is
used in tenacity to fix our unit tests for now. I think it might be
beneficial to not actually test the retry functionality in the paunch
unit tests as it seems to be more of a test for tenacity than paunch.

Change-Id: I37b09694de3ec9f31a7b945d19a83527c915b759
Related-Bug: #1788802
(cherry picked from commit e2093fb7fc0a0d35d5b3ac6a8b5d4a8c373d79c7)

subject: Cleanup transport along RPC clients
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-09-29 01:06:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-10-01 08:20:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 01:06:30.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup transport along RPC clients

This fixes a bad weird condition in the API server related to
cron-triggers and SIGHUP. The parent API server creates a RPC connection
when creating workflows from cron. If a SIGUP signal happens after, the
child inherits the connection, but it's non-functional.

Change-Id: Ic98e2db02abd8483591756d73e06784cc2e9cbe3
Closes-Bug: #1789680
(cherry picked from commit 5c005a7926060b6898b536962d2e88ea922f1a32)
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup transport along RPC clients

This fixes a bad weird condition in the API server related to
cron-triggers and SIGHUP. The parent API server creates a RPC connection
when creating workflows from cron. If a SIGUP signal happens after, the
child inherits the connection, but it's non-functional.

Change-Id: Ic98e2db02abd8483591756d73e06784cc2e9cbe3
Closes-Bug: #1789680
(cherry picked from commit 5c005a7926060b6898b536962d2e88ea922f1a32)

commit_message:
Cleanup transport along RPC clients

This fixes a bad weird condition in the API server related to
cron-triggers and SIGHUP. The parent API server creates a RPC connection
when creating workflows from cron. If a SIGUP signal happens after, the
child inherits the connection, but it's non-functional.

Change-Id: Ic98e2db02abd8483591756d73e06784cc2e9cbe3
Closes-Bug: #1789680
(cherry picked from commit 5c005a7926060b6898b536962d2e88ea922f1a32)

Sagi, can you please give an example where output from this command was too big to be readable on console? I guess you should be able to find a log file that fits that pattern.

This change displays the error *only* when the task fails so it does not increase the verbosity of of most executions. 

Somehow I find your remark contradictory to what you said on the other review about the huge ARA JSON being dumped to console (where we had proof that its size was ~25% of total lines). On the ARA JSON silencing CR you downvoted because information bay be needed, prefering to always spam console and here you argue that it would spam console, even if output would happen only in case of task failure.

Can we think about some constructive approach so we can move on? If really concerned about size, we could use a tail but nobody asked for it yet.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-09-21 07:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Make setup repo task output visible when errored

Improves UX by displaying the error on console and avoiding the
need to for the user to dig in another file.

Partial-Bug: #1787912
Change-Id: I2ae7e972e3a67e47d820030ad3eb23c05fb8b892

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:50:27.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I996ee8a245c3c220d32048ef23674cd867d773f3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I996ee8a245c3c220d32048ef23674cd867d773f3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Use iptables as section header instead of firewall
messages: [{'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-09-28 08:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-28 08:28:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-09-28 08:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-09-28 09:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-10-01 08:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 08:24:40.000000000', 'message': 'Use iptables as section header instead of firewall

The firewall section has been renamed in upstream ironic inspector:

https://github.com/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/7b2758546376394777c7d36c8f5bb62ff7ef3830

Consequently the iptables pxe filter does not work if the actual
dnsmasq interface name differs from the default (br-ctlplane), as can
be seen from this snippet of iptables-save output:

-A INPUT -i br-ctlplane -p udp -m udp --dport 67 -j ironic-inspector

Change-Id: Ic1d08b85e0b5992fbee489f2f9fd174982b5d493
'}]
commit_message:
Use iptables as section header instead of firewall

The firewall section has been renamed in upstream ironic inspector:

https://github.com/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/7b2758546376394777c7d36c8f5bb62ff7ef3830

Consequently the iptables pxe filter does not work if the actual
dnsmasq interface name differs from the default (br-ctlplane), as can
be seen from this snippet of iptables-save output:

-A INPUT -i br-ctlplane -p udp -m udp --dport 67 -j ironic-inspector

Change-Id: Ic1d08b85e0b5992fbee489f2f9fd174982b5d493

commit_message:
ovs-dpdkctl.sh function list_dpdk_nics only grabs the first nic

Adding translate, new line in for loop /etc/default/ovs-dpdkctl.conf
Removed '' around pci_whitelist args for DPDK. When multiple entries
present vswitchd does not start.

Closes-bug: #1718240

Change-Id: I8196d56fe78e9ec1a0504059b98bcb9d1ee33f76

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:53:43.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I75fad5fe119c0eff2ba26e5e287e7152b73a1e49
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I75fad5fe119c0eff2ba26e5e287e7152b73a1e49
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update pipeline for refstack compatibility

Re-align pipeline with default example pipeline; this includes
adding the following new middleware:

    - copy
    - ratelimit
    - symlink

Re-work SLO middleware configuration to avoid duplicated section.

Re-order middleware inline with documentation avoiding authentication
issues when using DLO/SLO features.

Drop proxy-server.conf validation; its brittle and function should be
validated by other tests anyway.

Change-Id: Ic9df7c12ee0bb402245ad2e64da0d905fe68890c
Closes-Bug: 1794255
(cherry picked from commit e92e8a75e054d63db12bbbcddee41e0d5c29255e)

Storm is required for running the Monasca thresholder component for
generating alerts.

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-29 23:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-10-01 08:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:53:54.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7d8972a912315a70359a7b6ff7c191bbe51ddf7c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7d8972a912315a70359a7b6ff7c191bbe51ddf7c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 01:05:54.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup transport along RPC clients

This fixes a bad weird condition in the API server related to
cron-triggers and SIGHUP. The parent API server creates a RPC connection
when creating workflows from cron. If a SIGUP signal happens after, the
child inherits the connection, but it's non-functional.

Change-Id: Ic98e2db02abd8483591756d73e06784cc2e9cbe3
Closes-Bug: #1789680
(cherry picked from commit 5c005a7926060b6898b536962d2e88ea922f1a32)
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup transport along RPC clients

This fixes a bad weird condition in the API server related to
cron-triggers and SIGHUP. The parent API server creates a RPC connection
when creating workflows from cron. If a SIGUP signal happens after, the
child inherits the connection, but it's non-functional.

Change-Id: Ic98e2db02abd8483591756d73e06784cc2e9cbe3
Closes-Bug: #1789680
(cherry picked from commit 5c005a7926060b6898b536962d2e88ea922f1a32)

Update openstack-on-lxd procedure re: lxc profiles

It is necessary to wait for bootstrapping to be completed
before altering the juju-default profile.

Change-Id: If434edeaa72a5b1ca96b8578e8f97fc23db966b4

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5220bfe8496d9578e65c14303d9ab6499f7a5aed
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'account_id': 29208, 'date': '2018-09-27 12:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-09-27 12:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-09-28 08:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hello, thank you for your comments!
Have addressed the comments:
- added the purpose to the commit message.
- added a unit test for the new public function
- removed the `vmsetting` from the public interface

This did create some questions:
- Should i also add a test for the new private function?

commit_message:
Add getter for MemorySettingsData

This will allow fetching various VM memory information, such as
dynamic memory limits and reserved amount.

Change-Id: Ifa9649e490a851090cdf3f8a0390e4ab7d5a6373

Ugh, you're right, the testing system seems to bypass the issue. It's trivially reproduced by

> Ugh, you're right, the testing system seems to bypass the issue.

 > curl -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" http://192.168.24.1:6385/foo

Yes, verified locally, it works. I am aware of this issue, it was exposed by the security test maybe a year before. The workaround was escaping xml reserved words, not a graceful solution. Looks good to me. I have no idea for passing no accept header in the unit tests, either.'}]

[{'created': '2018-08-28 12:54:42.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent HTML from appearing in API error messages

Currently if the request does not have an Accept header, all pecan
errors end up being HTML, which then gets wrapped into our standard

commit_message:
Prevent HTML from appearing in API error messages

Currently if the request does not have an Accept header, all pecan
errors end up being HTML, which then gets wrapped into our standard
error format. This change prevents it.

Change-Id: I1968ab20fdeced852744fac5e0e795e997ae6e34
Story: #1662228
Task: #24869

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-15 06:36:37.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iff786d273a1511b32fbdae4b5ad647c859df349f
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iff786d273a1511b32fbdae4b5ad647c859df349f

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
Gate: Update tempest deployment script

This updates the Tempest deployment script for the experimental
checks. Executing make pull-images isn't required, as the initial
setup-client step should verify the Tempest chart lints correctly

Change-Id: I6e5ead298737fd34824ffa97d4d9396f5a8173a4

[{'created': '2018-09-27 14:24:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix stacktraces with redis caching backend

If you use redis as a caching backend and you delete a server with
no consoleauth tokens you'll get a stacktrace as an empty list is
passed down to the redis client and ultimately the redis server
which responds with an error, complaining about a wrong number
of arguments for the del command.
The code now checks if the list of tokens is empty and only calls
the caching backend if there are tokens available to delete.
This also may improve performance, as it no longer hands down an
empty list.

Change-Id: Iffdd4e251bfa2bac1bfd49498e32b738843709de

commit_message:
Fix stacktraces with redis caching backend

If you use redis as a caching backend and you delete a server with
no consoleauth tokens you'll get a stacktrace as an empty list is
passed down to the redis client and ultimately the redis server
which responds with an error, complaining about a wrong number
of arguments for the del command.
The code now checks if the list of tokens is empty and only calls
the caching backend if there are tokens available to delete.
This also may improve performance, as it no longer hands down an
empty list.

Closes-Bug: #1794812
Change-Id: Iffdd4e251bfa2bac1bfd49498e32b738843709de

commit_message:
Update swift_rings_backup workflow to also backup ceph fetch dir

Rename swift_rings_backup to swift_backup because we might wish
to use swift on the undercloud to backup more than just the
overcloud swift rings. For example the same workflow is useful
for backing up the ceph-ansible fetch directory in the undercloud
swift.

Update deployment and plan management workflows to also create
or update the ceph-ansible fetch directory swift container.

Change-Id: Icce658f803a608ee4b7df34b0b8297ecabcdb0ee
Related-Bug: #1769769
(cherry picked from commit bdde61dec0ce2882bd9a591acfb94502b27a297e)

commit_message:
Horizon: HTTP Verb Tampering vulnerability fix

The patch fixes the HTTP verb tampering issue. The idea is to disable
unnecessary HTTP methods for the Horizon. You can find a link to
the description [0] and a link to the White Paper [1] below:

CAPEC-274: HTTP Verb Tampering
[0] https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/274.html

Bypassing Web Authentication and Authorization with HTTP Verb Tampering
(Bypassing_VBAAC_with_HTTP_Verb_Tampering.pdf)
[1] https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/web/Bypassing_VBAAC_with_HTTP_Verb_Tampering.pdf

Change-Id: I98169973410bc1dce779ac1e870256b9a45d2cc8

commit_message:
api-ref: mark name as optional in volume create API

The "name" parameter to the volume create API is optional,
this makes the docs reflect that. While in here, I've
renamed volume_name_1 to volume_name_optional so the variable
name is descriptive and dropped the redundant name_8 variable.

Change-Id: Ice42f06112a268b229f770f34096de19eb3447b2
Closes-Bug: #1794115

commit_message:
SRIOV: Limit number of vfs to n-1 created by default

This PS udpates the sriov init script to by default create the
max number of vfs supported by the card -1. Which works round
issues encoutered with many cards that prevents ther theroretical
max being attainable.

Change-Id: I01f8ce1f36b6053a5ef68119d87b67050ffe99d1
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Create V3 ServiceCatalog in context

as there's no more KeystoneV2, let's use V3 Catalog object in the
context auth plugin instead.

Also be less explicit in required Keystone API version, any v3 should
just work.

Change-Id: Ia8db2301ca8770e2ee7642c117645265a1a58d0f

commit_message:
Add the missing ceph_mon host groups for gnocchi

when gnocchi use ceph as backend, need set
gnocchi_backend_storage: "ceph", gnocchi will pull keyring
from ceph mon node [0], but the site.yml missing it.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/gnocchi/tasks/ceph.yml#L39

Change-Id: Ib33c26ee1fdfe683e5c9b3ef987d6da2c588116a
Closes-Bug: #1744010

commit_message:
Fix the profile missing when run bootstrap.sh

when use bootstrap.sh script to prepare the development
environment, the /etc/kolla/globlas.yml and
/etc/kolla/passwords.yml is missing, this ps to fix it.

Change-Id: Id00187ec032c7a6c98d0772def12f142ef13fb22
Closes-Bug: #1766081

commit_message:
Ingore monasca-thresh in version-check.py

monasca-thresh package is not published in
tarballs.openstack.org and fails to detect
proper version for it.
Add to external managed packages list

Change-Id: I5da4da1f5291e993fdcd04177c634147204ad9ed
(cherry picked from 3b264a919a578fdb691ff5c82349dcb7ac30d570)

commit_message:
use internalURL to connect to cinder in magnum

When tls is enabled, magnum failed to connect to cinder bacause of
missing ca file.

Use internalURL to connect to cinder will avoid the issue

Change-Id: I1608a3b0f6d3c7fa92cab8d1931b4e3735c8afd7
Closes-Bug: #1707121

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Make freezer-ubuntu-xenial non-voting, it fails on this branch.

Change-Id: Iae90ec3c2f58709e773b94984405b279e04c0036
Story: #2002586
Task: #24296

import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Mark freezer-api-ubuntu-xenial job as non-voting, it fails consistently
on this branch.

Story: #2002586
Task: #24296

commit_message:
Add build_target arguement to enforcer

This change adds in a new arguement "build_target" which takes
in a passed function to build the enforement target after
the authentication check. This is to avoid leaking existance
data when determining scope.

Change-Id: I9aab71dd0032d40aa2f2e088b529af08b112671f
Partial-Bug: #1776504

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-27 14:58:48.000000000', 'message': 'Use INFO for logging no allocation candidates

If the placement service returns no allocation candidates, the
log message is done in DEBUG leaving no information for the
operator to have visiblity on why the NoValidHost was raised.

If we do get something from the placement service that results
in 0 compute nodes after going through filters, we do log a
message in INFO.  This is to add consistency for a message
in INFO if we have no allocation candidates.

Closes-Bug: #1794811
Change-Id: Ief2277b3a973dd2f947f354f844ce1c6c4d6026a
'}]
commit_message:
Use INFO for logging no allocation candidates

If the placement service returns no allocation candidates, the
log message is done in DEBUG leaving no information for the
operator to have visiblity on why the NoValidHost was raised.

If we do get something from the placement service that results
in 0 compute nodes after going through filters, we do log a
message in INFO.  This is to add consistency for a message
in INFO if we have no allocation candidates.

Closes-Bug: #1794811
Change-Id: Ief2277b3a973dd2f947f354f844ce1c6c4d6026a

"}]
commit_message:
Explicit install of nova-compute on compute node

The package, nova-compute, seems to be no longer a dependency of
nova-compute-qemu. We need to install it explicitly or we won't
be able to start nova-compute.

Change-Id: I9c548f6f1354f4cb56d267133381b3dfb41fc194

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:54:30.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iaeef265278b390b6adc4d3826df3da67d23e42a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iaeef265278b390b6adc4d3826df3da67d23e42a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
use common rpc and exceptions from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.rpc and exceptions were rehomed into neutron-lib and
are currently shimmed in neutron [1]

This patch consumes those modules from neutron-lib by using lib's
modules rather than neutrons.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586525/

Change-Id: I3067035d6bbd44e1a2fe0102d62eb50f8cc7db86

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id637ce96fff8f06ad3c0c0e433870d2eaca17c85
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: opt in for neutron-lib consumption patches
messages: [{'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-09-25 19:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-09-30 09:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 19:26:39.000000000', 'message': 'opt in for neutron-lib consumption patches

As part of the Denver PTG [1] we decided networking related projects
that are "current" and want to receive neutron-lib consumption patches
on an on-going basis should indicate such with a well defined comment
in their requirements.txt. This allows us to easily find the list of
project to receive neutron-lib consumption patches [2] by searching for
the string.

In addition, projects opting-in for these patches are also attesting
they will stay up to date with TC and infra initiatives to ensure
consumption patches can flow freely.

This patch adds the "neutron-lib-current" string to requirements.txt
opting in for neutron-lib consumption patches.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-stein-ptg
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/contributing.html#phase-4-consume

Change-Id: Ie1d9ccb13b4188cd4ec8b4b18425524582addcac
'}]
commit_message:
opt in for neutron-lib consumption patches

As part of the Denver PTG [1] we decided networking related projects
that are "current" and want to receive neutron-lib consumption patches
on an on-going basis should indicate such with a well defined comment
in their requirements.txt. This allows us to easily find the list of
project to receive neutron-lib consumption patches [2] by searching for
the string.

In addition, projects opting-in for these patches are also attesting
they will stay up to date with TC and infra initiatives to ensure
consumption patches can flow freely.

This patch adds the "neutron-lib-current" string to requirements.txt
opting in for neutron-lib consumption patches.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-stein-ptg
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/contributing.html#phase-4-consume

Change-Id: Ie1d9ccb13b4188cd4ec8b4b18425524582addcac

fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic44c58e2d5523990b700128727a25b0630ec28de
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Pin r10k and cri gems

r10k released 3.0.0 yesterday which depends on the
cri gem that requires ruby >= 2.3.0 which we cannot
satisfy.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606009/
Closes-Bug: #1794585
Change-Id: I2fbe3f28f418d2c2a99894771d51f95e167bac54
(cherry picked from commit 052e6e43fe27f1d27fd496f46d04d395956db669)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I79fc47255ec7475398e81bcebee0ee0d459e397b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[MariaDB] Allow for stable upgrades

Using a random bootstrap filename means any upgrade (even without
changes) causes MariaDB to churn and restart.

Change-Id: Ieaf577e413f8d672d24bf42c90b6110b52e542f0

commit_message:
Remove references to jenkins jobs

- remove jjb environment from tox.ini
- remove jjb related ignores from .gitignore
- removed jenkins references in docs
- corrected setup.cfg to avoid pointing to jenkins files
- removed jenins-job-builder from test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ia32745f3229fb68f996f90580919aedde0224266

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-15 13:31:16.000000000', 'message': "Make sure rhel-plugin-push.service is stopped after pacemaker stops

When issuing a normal reboot command on an overcloud node the following
stop sequence can take place:
------------- -----------------------------
| Pacemaker | | paunch-container-shutdown |
------------- -----------------------------
          |     |
           \   /
            \ /
        ----------
        | docker |
        ----------

If there are docker plugins that are allowed to stop before docker and
also before pacemaker, it might happen that stopping them down during
the pacemaker stop will cause a bunch of timeouts and a failure to stop
containers:
Sep 13 17:53:00.821030 controller-0.localdomain pacemakerd[6147]: notice: Shutting down Pacemaker
Sep 13 17:54:15.798026 controller-0.localdomain lrmd[6284]: warning: galera-bundle-docker-0_monitor_60000 process (PID 226329) timed out
Sep 13 17:54:15.799004 controller-0.localdomain lrmd[6284]: warning: galera-bundle-docker-0_monitor_60000:226329 - timed out after 20000ms

One of these plugins is 'rhel-push-plugin.service'. It seems that when
this plugin is free to stop before docker on shutdown, it is very
possible that docker commands can start timing out.

Before:
Before adding the symlink we would need 15mins to reboot a node and
we would get a bunch of timeouts on shutdown and some failed actions on
boot.

After:
A reboot will take a reasonable couple of minutes to complete with no
failed actions at boot and timeouts during shutdown.

NB: We add the symlink unconditionally as systemd will ignore it if the
service is not installed.

Change-Id: I6f6d27f2457efcc49d9edd8a2f98484c5f7c0933
Closes-Bug: #1792701
"}, {'created': '2018-09-20 09:53:23.000000000', 'message': "Make sure rhel-plugin-push.service is stopped after pacemaker stops

stop sequence can take place:

------------- -----------------------------

           \   /
            \ /
        ----------
        | docker |
        ----------

If there are docker plugins that are allowed to stop before docker and
also before pacemaker, it might happen that stopping them down during
